text: Question 1.26 (a) Set ¢ =z + h and ¥ = zo. Then ¥ = 5o+ h/2 and 5% = h/2. This yields Fa(zo, h) = 2cos(xo + h/2) sin(h/2). (b) A different way for calculating (f(zo+h) — f(zo))/h for f(z) = sin(z) is obviously to calculate fa(®o,h)/h. This is shown to be quite accurate. The MATLAB part of this question is omitted.
